name: Mercury(II) thiocyanate
desc: Mercury(II) thiocyanate (Hg(SCN)2) is an inorganic chemical compound, the coordination complex of Hg2+ and the thiocyanate anion. It is a white powder. It will produce a large, winding “snake” when ignited, an effect known as the Pharaoh's serpent.
Solubility:
Soluble in dilute hydrochloric acid, KCN, ammonia
slightly soluble in alcohol, ether
